meanings.definition: The act of coating or covering with tin.
meanings.sent1: The tinning of the roof made it shiny and reflective.
meanings.sent2: I learned about tinning while watching a documentary about metalwork.
meanings.sent3: The tinning on the cake gave it a futuristic look.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the tinning on a new car, bright and flawless.
meanings.sent5: The tinning on the jewelry caught the sunlight and sparkled beautifully.

meanings.definition: The process of preserving food by sealing it in a tin container.
meanings.sent1: Grandma used tinning to keep her homemade jam fresh for months.
meanings.sent2: I always carry a tin for tinning leftovers when camping.
meanings.sent3: The tinning of the cookies kept them safe from hungry siblings.
meanings.sent4: The tinning of the vegetables in cans made them last through the winter.
meanings.sent5: The tinning of the soup in the pantry saved us during the storm.

meanings.definition: The act of soldering with tin.
meanings.sent1: His expertise in tinning made him the best craftsman in town.
meanings.sent2: I practiced tinning on small electronic components in my workshop.
meanings.sent3: The tinning of the wires was so neat, it looked like art.
meanings.sent4: She approached the delicate task of tinning with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: The tinning of the circuit board was flawless, ensuring a strong connection.
